```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
violence <- 
  read_csv("violence.csv")

view(violence)

filter(violence, SUBJECT == "PREVVIOLLIFETIME", TIME == 2019)
filter(violence, SUBJECT == "ATTITUDEVIOL", TIME == 2019)
filter(violence, SUBJECT== "LAWDOMVIOL", TIME == 2019)

##merging data so i have the continents/regions of the world

regionsdata<-
  read_csv("regionsdata.csv")

regionsdata <- rename(regionsdata, c("LOCATION" = "Country Code"))
view(regionsdata)

#Merging datasets

violence2 <- merge(violence,regionsdata,by="LOCATION")

LAWDOMVIOL2019 <- violence2 %>% 
  filter(SUBJECT=="LAWDOMVIOL", TIME==2019) %>% 
  mutate(LAWDOMVIOL=Value)

ATTITUDEVIOL2019 <- violence2 %>% 
  filter(SUBJECT=="ATTITUDEVIOL", TIME==2019) %>% 
  mutate(ATTITUDEVIOL=Value)

PREVVIOLLIFETIME2019 <- violence2 %>% 
  filter(SUBJECT=="PREVVIOLLIFETIME", TIME==2019) %>% 
  mutate(PREVVIOLLIFETIME=Value)

mergeddata1 <- merge(LAWDOMVIOL2019, ATTITUDEVIOL2019, by="LOCATION")
finalmergeddata<- merge(mergeddata1,PREVVIOLLIFETIME2019, by="LOCATION" )

violencedata<- finalmergeddata[c(1,6,9,10,14,27,40)]
violencedata<- rename(violencedata, c("Year" = "TIME.x"))
violencedata<- rename(violencedata, c("Region" = "Region.x"))
violencedata<- rename(violencedata, c("IncomeGroup" = "IncomeGroup.x"))

##Organized the Dataset in a way in which countries are in the same row

#Exploring LAWDOMVIOL by region and incomegroup
ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=LAWDOMVIOL))+
  facet_wrap(~IncomeGroup)

ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=LAWDOMVIOL))+
  facet_wrap(~Region)

#Exploring ATTITUDEVIOL by region and incomegroup
ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=ATTITUDEVIOL))+
  facet_wrap(~IncomeGroup)

ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=ATTITUDEVIOL))+
  facet_wrap(~Region)

#Exploring PREVVLIFETIME by region and incomegroup
ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=PREVVIOLLIFETIME))+
  facet_wrap(~IncomeGroup)

ggplot(violencedata)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=PREVVIOLLIFETIME))+
  facet_wrap(~Region)


```

  geom_point()+
  labs(title = "Relationship between Law on domestic violence and attitudes towards violence", x = "Law on domestic violence", y = "attitudes towards violence")
